orbit_classes.name: Unclassified Comet
orbit_classes.desc: Comets whose orbits do not match any defined orbit class
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: whose orbit does not match any defined comet orbit class

orbit_classes.name: Chiron-type Comet
orbit_classes.desc: Chiron-type comet, as defined by Levison and Duncan (TJupiter > 3; a > aJupiter)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: whose orbit is approximately between Jupiter and Neptune

orbit_classes.name: Encke-type Comet
orbit_classes.desc: Encke-type comet, as defined by Levison and Duncan (TJupiter > 3; a < aJupiter)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: whose orbit brings it closer to the sun than Jupiter

orbit_classes.name: Halley-type Comet
orbit_classes.desc: Halley-type comet, classical definition (20 y < P < 200 y)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: with a medium-length orbit that is highly inclined to the ecliptic plane of the solar system

orbit_classes.name: Hyperbolic Comet
orbit_classes.desc: Comets on hyperbolic orbits (e > 1.0)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: with a trajectory through the solar system likely originating from the Oort Cloud

orbit_classes.name: Jupiter-family Comet
orbit_classes.desc: Jupiter-family comets, as defined by Levison and Duncan (2 < TJupiter < 3)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: whose orbit features a relatively short period, low inclination, and is controlled by Jupiter's gravitational effects

orbit_classes.name: Parabolic Comet
orbit_classes.desc: Comets on parabolic orbits (e = 1.0)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: with an extremely long orbital period, likely originating from the Oort Cloud

orbit_classes.name: Amor-class Asteroid
orbit_classes.desc: Near-Earth asteroid whose orbits are similar to that of 1221 Amor (a > 1.0 AU; 1.017 AU < q < 1.3 AU)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: whose orbit approaches the orbit of Earth but does not cross it

orbit_classes.name: Apollo-class Asteroid
orbit_classes.desc: Near-Earth asteroids whose orbits cross the Earth's orbit similar to that of 1862 Apollo (a > 1.0 AU; q < 1.017 AU).
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: whose orbit crosses the orbit of Earth

orbit_classes.name: Asteroid
orbit_classes.desc: Asteroid orbit not matching any defined orbit class
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: whose orbit does not match any defined asteroid orbital class

orbit_classes.name: Aten-class Asteroid
orbit_classes.desc: Near-Earth asteroid orbits similar to that of 2062 Aten (a < 1.0 AU; Q > 0.983 AU)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: whose orbit could bring it in close proximity to Earth

orbit_classes.name: Centaur-class Asteroid
orbit_classes.desc: Objects with orbits between Jupiter and Neptune (5.5 AU < a < 30.1 AU)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: with an orbit between Jupiter and Neptune

orbit_classes.name: Hyperbolic Asteroid
orbit_classes.desc: Asteroids on hyperbolic orbits (e > 1.0)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: with an orbit not bound to the sun

orbit_classes.name: Interior-Earth Asteroid
orbit_classes.desc: Asteroids with orbits contained entirely within the orbit of the Earth (Q < 0.983 AU)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: with an orbit that is entirely confined within Earth's orbit

orbit_classes.name: Inner Main-belt Asteroid
orbit_classes.desc: Asteroids with orbital elements constrained by (a < 2.0 AU; q > 1.666 AU)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: orbiting between Mars and Jupiter within the inner portion of the asteroid belt

orbit_classes.name: Main-belt Asteroid
orbit_classes.desc: Asteroids with orbital elements constrained by (2.0 AU < a < 3.2 AU; q > 1.666 AU)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: orbiting between Mars and Jupiter in the main portion of the asteroid belt

orbit_classes.name: Mars-crossing Asteroid
orbit_classes.desc: Asteroids that cross the orbit of Mars constrained by (1.3 AU < q < 1.666 AU; a < 3.2 AU)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: with an orbit that crosses the orbit of Mars

orbit_classes.name: Outer Main-belt Asteroid
orbit_classes.desc: Asteroids with orbital elements constrained by (3.2 AU < a < 4.6 AU)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: that orbits between Mars and Jupiter in the outer reaches of the main asteroid belt

orbit_classes.name: Parabolic Asteroid
orbit_classes.desc: Asteroids on parabolic orbits (e = 1.0)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: with an unusual orbit that brings it far beyond the normal boundaries of asteroids in the solar system

orbit_classes.name: Jupiter Trojan
orbit_classes.desc: Asteroids trapped in Jupiter's L4/L5 Lagrange points (4.6 AU < a < 5.5 AU; e < 0.3)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: that shares Jupiter's orbit around the sun

orbit_classes.name: Trans-Neptunian Object
orbit_classes.desc: Objects with orbits outside Neptune (a > 30.1 AU)
orbit_classes.orbit_sentence: whose orbit extends beyond the orbit of Neptune
